RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Claiming Purse 13800. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROADWAY SKY dueled early dropped back slightly down the backside, rallied on the far turn and gained a clear lead, drew off in the stretch to win as much the best, handily. AWESOME BREAK was allowed to settle, rallied in the stretch, was no match for for the winner but was up for place. SHEA D CAPTURE raced inside and had no rally late. BLUNDER hopped at the start, rallied down the backside and around the far turn, then weakened in the stretch. WHEN IN ROME dueled early, gained a clear lead down the backside, tired on the far turn and quickly gave way. BON DEUX was no menace.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JULY 23. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: Z U SOON dueled on the lead throughout, prevailed late, gamely. D'MONEY HONEY dueled with the winner throughout, held stubbornly and just missed. ALL STAR JUSTICE tracked four wide and went evenly late. KREWE CHIEF allowed to settle early, raced between horses in the stretch and was no threat. COLOMBARD was well placed on the inside and faded in the stretch. LOOKS GOOD N A TUX allowed to settle, failed to menace. GIO SAMMY hopped at the start, rallied four wide down the backside, remained a sharp factor at the quarter pole, gave way in the stretch. BALTIC FLEET raced wide and was outrun.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 67. Allowance Purse 25900. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 23 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOSHEN had good position early, rallied on the turn three wide, battled through the stretch and prevailed late under left handed urging. SEACHROME dueled on the lead throughout, held gamely after a long stretch battle and just missed. WORLD UNITE was never far back, rallied on the turn four wide and drew close and lacked a late response. LADY GIULIANA contended early while between horses and weakened in the stretch. BE SHARP dueled inside and was through after a half. UNESCORTED saved ground and was no menace. CHRISTINA ANN trailed.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Purse 26400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 23 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DYRDEK was allowed to settle early, rallied on the turn five wide with a quick move, drew off late under left handed urging to win going away. TRAGICALLY QUEWICK raced just off the speed, rallied in the stretch, was no match for the winner late but was second best. OHIO MUNNY set the pace with a clear lead until mid stretch and faltered late. UNCLE CHARMING raced close up and lacked a late response. IT'S YOUR CALL ducked slightly at the start and was outrun. OHIO PLAYER contended for a half and tired in mid stretch.

RACE.FOOTNOTES: VALHALLA AIR BASE was well placed early, rallied on the far turn three wide, drew off late while being ridden out EL SICARIO dueled on the lead until the stretch, could not match strides late with the winner but was clearly second best. TOP HAT BLITZ had good position, on the inside and went evenly late. MR. COMMISH was unhurried early, saved ground and passed tiring rivals. GOLDEN OAK was in tight in the first turn, had a mild bid while no threat. PRETTY LOUD was unhurried early, swung wide in the stretch and passed tiring foes. PUBLIC RECORD raced close up early and tired in the stretch. PASION AZTECA raced mid pack and had no bid. STOP MAKING SENSE dueled early and tired on the far turn. STAYIN OR STRAYIN wide early, was outrun.

Non-winners Of A Race Since December 23 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONEMORANDTHECHECK was away alertly and dueled on the lead throughout, dug in gamely after a long battle and prevailed. DAWN WEST was never far back, rallied in the stretch four wide and just missed. PLAIN OR PEANUT dueled with the winner throughout and held stubbornly in the drive. GULLANE raced mid pack early, rallied on the far turn, was in tight in the stretch on the rail and lacked racing room. GRAY MAMBA was unhurried early, and was no threat. STAR ENTERTAINER allowed to settle, failed to menace. SILVER MATT wouldn't load gate, raced close up for three quarters, then gave way. LAST COOKIE was outrun.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 17500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOT A GAME raced in the second flight on the inside, rallied in the stretch on the rail, closed determinedly and prevailed. TALKTOEACHOTHER dueled on the lead throughout, held gamely through a long battle and just missed. WHISKEY SUNRISE had good position three wide, finished willingly in a good effort to just miss. TEMPLE TITAN was never far back, lacked a late response and went evenly. CHROMED IMPULSE raced four wide and was no threat. POUR ME A DOUBLE raced between horses and was no menace. MASTER broke sharply and dueled on the lead, weakened in the stretch.

Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 23 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAN I GO TOO raced mid pack early, rallied in the stretch six wide, closed stoutly and drew off. DANZA MAGIC was never far back, swung seven wide in the stretch and finished well to be second best . MARGARITA CINCO had good position early, rallied in the stretch on the inside and gained a clear lead, was outfinished late. SORORITY SISTER had good position throughout and went evenly late. BIRDIE'S CHANTZ raced wide early and was no menace. QUEENIE ROSE had good position on the inside and lacked a late response. STORM OF NINETEEN dueled on the lead for a half, bore out in the stretch and weakened. PATTI LOU was off slowly and was outrun. EXACTITUDE dueled on the lead for a half, then stopped in the stretch.
